name: General Body Meeting
description: The first General Body Meeting introduced the club’s goals and upcoming research opportunities. Members from across CMU connected to learn about the club’s plans for Qiskit Fall Fest. Attendees were invited to join the mailing list to stay updated on future events.

name: Kickoff & Speaker Panel
description: We hosted our first Qiskit Fall Fest event featuring Dr. Jim Garrison from IBM, who shared his insights into quantum computing and his professional journey. Thanks to all who joined us! Don’t miss the next workshop on November 2nd, where Jake Zaia will introduce the fundamentals of quantum computing.

name: Quantum Basics & Qiskit Session
description: Led by Jake Zaia, this session covered foundational quantum computing concepts including qubits, Dirac notation, and single-qubit operations. Participants completed hands-on exercises using the IBM Qiskit self-graded notebook to solidify their understanding.

name: Quantum Circuits & Qiskit Workshop
description: Jake Zaia led an interactive workshop focused on multiqubit systems and quantum circuit compilation. Attendees built and compiled quantum circuits through guided hands-on exercises using IBM Qiskit notebooks.

name: Quantum Algorithms & Deep Dive Workshops
description: This extended session introduced key quantum algorithms including VQE. Participants split into focused workshops to explore and practice algorithms such as Bernstein-Vazirani, Deutsch-Jozsa, Grover, and Shor, engaging in hands-on activities.

name: Special Q&A with Derek Wang (IBM)
description: Derek Wang from IBM hosted a dynamic Q&A session, sharing recent quantum research updates and answering participant questions. This event provided valuable insights and sparked engaging discussions.

name: Tartanhacks - Quantum Track
description: We spoke at and sponsored the Quantum Track at Tartanhacks. We also hosted a demo session on February 7th at 11:00 AM in Danforth, showcasing quantum computing applications. Attendees were invited to join the workshop and explore the exciting quantum integrations and projects created by hackers over the weekend.

name: Future Leaders in Quantum (FLIQ) Hackathon
description: CMU Quantum Club helped organize in the global virtual Future Leaders in Quantum (FLIQ) Hackathon, co-hosted by the Quantum Coalition and ITU in celebration of the UN International Year of Quantum. The hackathon featured eight challenges from leading organizations including IonQ, IBM Quantum, Classiq Technologies, UNICC, Moth, and ID Quantique. Participants competed for a $10,000 prize pool and a funded trip to Geneva to attend the AI for Good Summit. The CMU Quantum Club proudly contributed to the Innovation Track, co-curated with ID Quantique and Carnegie Mellon University, showcasing the impact of quantum technology advancements on a global stage.
